DOC.brief_summary: The study will be a prospective cohort study of 20 patients recruited from site's Defibrillator Clinic patient population who are followed at the site. Hypothesis: Among the available EGM configuration options, one is better than the others for detection enhancements purposes.
DOC.brief_title: Optimal EGM Configuration for Morphology Discrimination
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients must already have an implanted St. Jude Medical dual chamber ICD with a dual coil defibrillator lead. 2. Patients must be willing to sign an informed consent form. 3. Patients must have frequent PVCs (minimum of 30/hour) 1. Known history of slow VT (under 160 bpm). 2. Patients under the age of 18 years. 3. Pregnant women. 4. Pacemaker dependent rhythm. 5. Ongoing angina pectoris. 6. Current NYHA Class 34 heart failure.
DOC.keyword: ICD patients with PVCs and EGM recordings
